name: Moonfall Shrine
content:
Moonfall Shrine

Moonfall Shrine stands as a relic of fractured faith — a place once united in worship now claimed by all and owned by none. Prayer flags hang in tatters across scorched stone, and memory-altars rise from the ash like teeth in a forgotten mouth. Charred votive pits still breathe warmth, refusing to cool entirely, as if mourning something no one remembers clearly enough to name.


The wind moves differently here, tugging at incense smoke and broken prayer beads as though searching for voices long gone. Fragments of moonstone glitter underfoot, half-buried in cracked earth. Whispers cling to the shrine — soft, pleading, unfinished — echoing through the ruins with a weight that suggests they were never meant to stop.
